short_description: SQL/MR function to train a Fellegi-Sunter model
long_description: SQL/MR function to train a Fellegi-Sunter model

argument_clauses.name: Domain
argument_clauses.description: The address of the Queen. The host parameter is the Aster Database Queenâ€™s IP saddress or hostname.

argument_clauses.name: Database
argument_clauses.description: The name of the database where the input table is located.

argument_clauses.name: UserId
argument_clauses.description: The Aster Database user name of the user running this function.

argument_clauses.name: Password
argument_clauses.description: The Aster Database password of the user.

argument_clauses.name: SSLSettings
argument_clauses.description: A string that includes all the SSL settings, except the password for the truststore.

argument_clauses.name: SSLTrustStorePassword
argument_clauses.description: The password for the SSL truststore.

argument_clauses.name: InputTable
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the table that contains the object pairs and their field-pair similarity values

argument_clauses.name: TagColumn
argument_clauses.description: If you specify this argument, then the function uses supervised learning; if you omit it, then the function uses unsupervised learning. This argument specifies the name of the column that indicates whether two objects match. The column must contain only the values 'M' (matched) and 'U' (unmatched)

argument_clauses.name: InitialM
argument_clauses.description: For unsupervised learning, this argument specifies the initial value of m, which is the probability that a field agrees, given that the object-pair belongs to the same object. The default value is 0.9. The input value must be greater than 0.0 and less than 1.0. The default value is 0.9.

argument_clauses.name: InitialU
argument_clauses.description: For unsupervised learning, this argument specifies the initial value of u, which is the probability that a field agrees, given that the object-pair belongs to a different object. The default value is 0.1. The input value must be greater than 0.0 and less than 1.0. The default value is 0.1.

argument_clauses.name: InitialP
argument_clauses.description: For unsupervised learning, this argument specifies the initial value of p, which is the percentage of all possible object-pairs that contain the same object. The default value is 0.1. The input value must be greater than 0.0 and less than 1.0. The default value is 0.1.

argument_clauses.name: MaxIteration
argument_clauses.description: For unsupervised learning, this argument specifies the maximum number of iterations. The default value is 100. The input value must be no less than 10. The default value is 100.

argument_clauses.name: Eta
argument_clauses.description: For unsupervised learning, this argument specifies the tolerance of the termination criterion. At the end of each iteration, the function computes the difference between the current value of p and the value of p at the end of the previous iteration. If the difference is less than eta_value, then the function terminates.The default value is 0.0001. The input value must be greater than 0.0. The default value is 1.0E-5.

argument_clauses.name: Mu
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the Type II (false positive) error, which occurs if a matched comparison is erroneously not linked. The default value is 0.9. The input value must be greater than 0.0. The default value is 0.9.

argument_clauses.name: Lambda
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the Type I (false negative) error, which occurs if an unmatched comparison is erroneously linked. The default value is 0.9. The input value must be greater than 0.0. The default value is 0.9.
